update.description:
Make sure you have a joystick connected. If using docker, be sure to run with `--device=/dev/input/js0`.

On one terminal:

~~~
cd examples/standalone/joystick
mkdir build
cd build
cmake ..
make
./joystick ../joystick.sdf
~~~

On another terminal:

~~~
cd examples/standalone/joy_to_twist
mkdir build
cd build
cmake ..
make
./joy_to_twist ../joy_to_twist.sdf
~~~

On a 3rd terminal:

~~~
cd ign-gazebo
ign-gazebo -v 4 -f examples/worlds/diff_drive.sdf
~~~

Unpause and command away!

---

## TODO (MVP)

* ~~Finish passing SDF args for `joy_to_twist`~~
* ~~Fix style~~

Done!

## TODO (future)

* "launch" standalone programs from `ign-gazebo`?
* Integration tests
update.title: Joystick teleop

content.raw: Alternatively, you could add a README.md to the `examples/standalong/joystick` directory.
content.html: Alternatively, you could add a README.md to the examples/standalong/joystick directory.

content.raw: Thanks. I was not pressing the A key.
content.html: Thanks. I was not pressing the A key.

content.raw:
It's the same as here: http://wiki.ros.org/joy

With the given SDF file and the joystick on my desk, you need to hold A for normal mode and B for turbo.
content.html:
It's the same as here: http://wiki.ros.org/joy

With the given SDF file and the joystick on my desk, you need to hold A for normal mode and B for turbo.

content.raw: `joystick.cc` is a copy of `JoyPlugin`, but I didn't find any code on Gazebo which converted the joystick messages into commands (twist or pose), so I adapted that package.
content.html: joystick.cc is a copy of JoyPlugin, but I didn't find any code on Gazebo which converted the joystick messages into commands (twist or pose), so I adapted that package.

content.raw: Also, what's the joystick mapping? I'm failing to make the vehicles move.
content.html: Also, what's the joystick mapping? I'm failing to make the vehicles move.

content.raw: Can you capture this PR's description into a tutorial?
content.html: Can you capture this PR's description into a tutorial?

content.raw: Just checking to see if you compared this code to what Gazebo classic uses: https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/582827025ea59c832cc50e33d64a07ae13cad76a/plugins/JoyPlugin.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default
content.html: Just checking to see if you compared this code to what Gazebo classic uses: https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/582827025ea59c832cc50e33d64a07ae13cad76a/plugins/JoyPlugin.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default

content.raw: This is ready to be reviewed!

content.raw: I'm still cleaning up this PR, I'll move these to SDF parameters.
content.html: I'm still cleaning up this PR, I'll move these to SDF parameters.

content.raw: Do you want to keep these comments? If so, can you add some text about why they are commented?
content.html: Do you want to keep these comments? If so, can you add some text about why they are commented?

content.raw: In your TODO section, about gazebo launching additional programs. I don't think gazebo should take on this role. Launching and managing programs was the intent of [ign launch](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-launch), which should probably be revived.
content.html: In your TODO section, about gazebo launching additional programs. I don't think gazebo should take on this role. Launching and managing programs was the intent of ign launch, which should probably be revived.

content.raw: Nice catch, fixed a couple of other instances too: f3b70be
content.html: Nice catch, fixed a couple of other instances too: f3b70be

content.raw: Since this is in a standalone example, this should be a regular `find_package()` call rather than `ign_find_package()` \(which is only meant to be used by `ignition` packages\).
content.html: Since this is in a standalone example, this should be a regular find_package() call rather than ign_find_package() (which is only meant to be used by ignition packages).
